auth.no_roles: You do not have any roles. Please contact the Server Administrator.
auth.not_authorized: You do not have permission to access this page.

session_expiring.message: Your session will expire in 3 minutes. Save your work and log in again to continue.

add.intro: Choose subsystems and groups that will get access to endpoint {{path}} of service {{serviceId}}.
add.intro_all: Choose subsystems and groups that will get access to all endpoints of service {{serviceId}}.
add.intro_soap: Choose subsystems and groups that will get access to service {{serviceId}}.
add.subject: Subsystem/Group
add.title: Add Access

intro.general: This service has multiple versions. Different versions of the same service share access rights.
intro.rest: Adding rights to access an endpoint in one version will give access to the same endpoint in other versions as well.
intro.soap: Adding rights to access one version of a service will give access to other versions as well.

remove.confirm_group: Are you sure you want to remove access to service {{serviceCode}} from group {{displayValue}}?
remove.confirm_sub: Are you sure you want to remove access to service {{serviceCode}} from subsystem {{displayValue}}?

tooltips.multiple_versions: Service versions that have this endpoint

add_client.add_unregistered_org_confirmation: The organization {{memberId}} is not registered as a UXP member. You can add the client, but you must register the member in Governing Authority before you can start exchanging messages. Continue to add the client?
add_client.cannot_add_clients_limit_reached: Can not add new clients because the client limit ({{maxClients}}) set by the license is reached.
add_client.cannot_add_clients_no_valid_license: Can not add new clients because the security server has no valid license.
add_client.title: Add Client

deletion.certs_and_keys_confirmation:
{{subsystemCode}} was the last client belonging to the member {{member}} in this server.
Do you want to delete the signing certificates and keys related to the member {{member}}?
deletion.confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete the client {{client}} from the security server?
deletion.title: Delete Client

registration.client_registration_confirmation_client_: Are you sure you want to register the subsystem {{subsystem}} in the security server?
Are you sure you want to register the subsystem {{subsystem}} in the security server? New subsystem {{subsystemCode}} will be submitted for registration for member {{member}}.
registration.no_valid_auth_cert:
Can not register clients because the security server has no functioning authentication certificate. 

To send the request, there must be at least one authentication certificate that is registered, with a good OCSP response, active and not expired.
registration.no_valid_license: Can not register clients because the security server has no valid license.
registration.no_valid_sign_cert:
Can not register clients because the security server owner has no functioning signing certificate. 

To send the request, the owner must have at least one signing certificate that is with a good OCSP response, active and not expired.
registration.success_paragraph_1: You need to forward your security server ID {{serverId}} and the client ID {{clientId}} to the Governing Authority by other means as well to complete the client registration. If you have not already done this, follow the instructions of your Governing Authority for this process.
registration.success_paragraph_2: The client registration request will be confirmed by a person in the Governing Authority and might take a few days.
registration.title: Register Client

unregistration.confirmation: Are you sure you want to unregister the client {{client}} from the security server? Information systems related to this client will not be able to exchange messages any more.
unregistration.deletion_confirmation: Request sent. Do you want to delete the client {{client}}?
unregistration.no_valid_auth_cert:
Can not unregister clients because the security server has no functioning authentication certificate. 

To send the request, there must be at least one authentication certificate that is registered, with a good OCSP response, active and not expired.
unregistration.no_valid_license: Can not unregister clients because the security server has no valid license.
unregistration.no_valid_sign_cert:
Can not unregister clients because the security server owner has no functioning signing certificate. 

To send the request, the owner must have at least one signing certificate that is with a good OCSP response, active and not expired.
unregistration.title: Unregister Client

http_headers.confirm_delete: Are you sure you want to delete the HTTP header {{key}}?
http_headers.section_intro: You can define HTTP headers that security server will then add to incoming request before forwarding the requests to the service.

tooltips.rest: If the incoming request already contains a header listed here, this setting will determine which one will be forwarded to the service. Comparison is case-insensitive.
tooltips.soap: Security server does not forward client's headers for SOAP messages. The header here is always sent to the service.

information_systems.cert_tip: Export the security server internal TLS certificate to the trusted certificates on the information system.
information_systems.connection_type: Connection type for service client information systems
information_systems.connection_type_desc: Connection type (http/https) for servers in service provider role is configured in the SOAP Services (<soapIcon/>) and REST APIs (<restIcon/>) tabs by editing the service or API settings.

information_systems.delete_cert_confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete the internal TLS certificate of client information system {{subject}}?
information_systems.no_server_certs: No security server internal TLS certificates.
information_systems.nossl_tooltip: No encryption nor authentication. Insecure connection.
information_systems.owner_https_only: Information systems making requests on behalf of the security server owner must use authenticated HTTPS connections to avoid security issues.
information_systems.ssl_noauth_tooltip: Encrypted connection, but security server does not authenticate the information system.
information_systems.ssl_tooltip: Information system and security server mutually authenticate each other. Secure encrypted connection.
information_systems.title: Information Systems
information_systems.upload_desc: Upload the certificates of information systems (in the service client or service provider role) which identify as {{clientIdentifier}}
information_systems.upload_desc_provider: Upload the certificate of the information system that provides this service. The list contains certificates of all the information systems for subsystem {{clientIdentifier}}

tooltip.can_sign: This member can sign UXP messages.
tooltip.cant_sign_missing: This member can not sign UXP messages, add a valid signing certificate.
tooltip.cant_sign_unavailable: This member can not sign UXP messages - key is unavailable. Check token.
tooltip.checking: Security server is checking signing certificate information.
tooltip.unknown: Security server could not determine signing certificate information.

add.success: Device '{{deviceName}}' successfully added. See the device on <textLink>Signature Creation Devices</textLink> page.
add.title: Add Signature Creation Device

delete.confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete the signature creation device {{deviceName}} from the security server? The device has no tokens in this security server.
delete.title: Delete Signature Creation Device
delete.token_disclaimer: To avoid deleting important keys by accident, you must delete all tokens and their content from security server before you can delete the device.
delete.token_info_one: The device {{deviceName}} has {{count}} token saved in this security server:
delete.token_info_other: The device {{deviceName}} has {{count}} tokens saved in this security server:

session_pool_capacity.description: Indicates how many concurrent PKCS#11 sessions are kept in the session pool for this device. If session pool is exhausted, new non-pooled sessions are created.
session_pool_capacity.label: Session pool capacity

session_time_to_live_seconds.description: Indicates how many seconds a PKCS#11 session stays in the pool and can be reused. Session pooling is disabled when this value is set to 0.
session_time_to_live_seconds.label: Session time to live (seconds)

token_operation_timeout_seconds.description: Indicates how many seconds to wait before timing out certain operations with tokens (if device driver does not respond).
token_operation_timeout_seconds.label: Token operation timeout

library_path.description: The path to the PKCS #11 library of the device driver.
library_path.label: Library path

max_signing_sessions.description: Indicates how many concurrent signing sessions are allowed to be created for this device.
max_signing_sessions.label: Maximum number of signing sessions

os_thread_creation_allowed.description: True if application threads which are executing calls to the PKCS #11 library may use native operating system calls to spawn new threads (in other words, the libraryâ€™s code may create its own threads); false if they may not.
os_thread_creation_allowed.label: Native threads allowed

os_thread_locking_allowed.description: True if the PKCS #11 library can use the native operation system threading model for locking; false otherwise.
os_thread_locking_allowed.label: Native thread locking allowed

priv_key_attribute_decrypt.description: Indicates whether private key can be used for decryption.
priv_key_attribute_decrypt.label: Private key decryption allowed

priv_key_attribute_derive.description: Indicates whether private key can be used for deriving other keys.
priv_key_attribute_derive.label: Private key derivation allowed

priv_key_attribute_extractable.description: Indicates whether private key can be extracted from the device.
priv_key_attribute_extractable.label: Private key can be extracted from the device

priv_key_attribute_sensitive.description: Indicates whether private key is sensitive.
priv_key_attribute_sensitive.label: Private key is sensitive

priv_key_attribute_sign_recover.description: Indicates whether private key can be used for signing with recovery.
priv_key_attribute_sign_recover.label: Private key signing with recovery allowed

priv_key_attribute_unwrap.description: Indicates whether private key can be used for unwrapping wrapped keys.
priv_key_attribute_unwrap.label: Private key unwrapping allowed

priv_key_attribute_wrap_with_trusted.description: Indicates whether private key can only be wrapped with a wrapping key with the trusted attribute set to true.
priv_key_attribute_wrap_with_trusted.label: Private key wrapping requires trusted key

pub_key_attribute_derive.description: Indicates whether public key can be used for deriving other keys.
pub_key_attribute_derive.label: Public key derivation allowed

pub_key_attribute_encrypt.description: Indicates whether public key can be used for encryption.
pub_key_attribute_encrypt.label: Public key encryption allowed

pub_key_attribute_trusted.description: Indicates whether public key is trusted when wrapping other keys.
pub_key_attribute_trusted.label: Whether public key is trusted

pub_key_attribute_verify_recover.description: Indicates whether public key can be used for verification with recovery.
pub_key_attribute_verify_recover.label: Public key verification with recovery allowed

pub_key_attribute_wrap.description: Indicates whether public key can be used for wrapping other keys.
pub_key_attribute_wrap.label: Public key wrapping allowed

rsa_sign_mechanism.description: Specifies the RSA signing mechanism. Should not be changed after generating RSA keys on device tokens.
rsa_sign_mechanism.label: RSA signing mechanism

session_idle_timeout_seconds.description: Indicates how many seconds need to pass for an idle session to be removed from the pool.
session_idle_timeout_seconds.label: Signing session idle timeout (seconds)

token_identity_source.description: Specifies which token information should be used as part of the token alias. On certain devices the slot ID may change occasionally, in which case serial number may be a better choice.
token_identity_source.label: Token identity source

token_operation_timeout_seconds.description: Indicates how many seconds to wait before timing out certain operations with tokens (if device driver does not respond).
token_operation_timeout_seconds.label: Token operation timeout

tooltip.device_disabled: Connection with the device is disabled. No signing is performed.
tooltip.tokens_not_operational: Security server could not detect any functioning tokens from the device. Check the device connection and its parameters in security server.
tooltip.tokens_operational: Security server can successfully read token(s) information from the device.

conflicts.no_instance: Instance is not configured. Make sure that a valid configuration anchor has been uploaded.

generate_csr.hsm_enabled: Security server detected an addon for signature creation devices installed on this server. If you need to store the server owner signing key on an external device, skip this step and finish configuring certificates in the administration view where you can first connect the signature device to the server.
generate_csr.intro: Security server has two important certificates: signing and authentication certificate. Both are needed for message exchange and to register a security server with the Governing Authority.
generate_csr.intro_cert_header: Configure these two certificates as follows:
generate_csr.intro_option_1: Generate a key and a CSR for both certificates.
generate_csr.intro_option_2: Forward CSRs to your certification service provider to request certificates.

import_certificates.intro:
After your certification service provider has processed your CSRs and sent you the certificates, import the certificates to this security server.
(You can redownload <signCsrLink>signing CSR</signCsrLink> or <authCsrLink>authentication CSR</authCsrLink> generated in the last step.)

securityserver.address: Security server public DNS name or IP address

owner.intro_1: Enter the UXP identifier of the organization who will own this security server.
owner.intro_2: You can continue by entering the planned member ID, but the registration must be completed at your Governing Authority before you can use the server to exchange messages.
owner.member_name_not_found: Member not found in global configuration
owner.member_name_tooltip: Member name is assigned during member registration in Governing Authority
owner.unregistered_owner: The organization {{memberId}} is not registered as a UXP member. You can still continue with the server initialization, but the owner must become a member before the server can be used. You can not change the owner later so make sure the identifier is correct.

registration.intro: Authentication certificate must be registered with the Governing Authority before it can be used. The value for the listening port is taken from the configuration file.
registration.paragraph_1: You need to send the certificate to the Governing Authority by other means as well to complete the registration. If you have not already done this, follow the instructions of your Governing Authority for this process.
registration.paragraph_2: The certificate registration request will be confirmed by a person in the Governing Authority and might take a few days.

skip.paragraph: Your security server cannot exchange messages until you have configured the authentication certificate and the signing certificate. If you skip configuring server certificates now, you can complete it later in the security server UI on the Server Certificates page. For more information, see the Security Server User Guide section Security Server Registration.
skip.title: Warning

timestamping.intro: Security server uses timestamping to preserve the evidential value of messages exchanged over UXP. Timestamping is provided by an external service and each security server must have at least one timestamping service approved by the Governing Authority.
timestamping.no_services: There are currently no timestamping services approved by the Governing Authority. You can continue with the configuration and add the service later.

token.intro: Security server uses cryptographic keys and stores them on a software token. The keys on the token are protected by a PIN. Set a PIN for the token and store it in a safe place. The keys may become unusable once the PIN is forgotten.

device.intro: Choose a certificate to import from token {{ tokenName }} on device {{ deviceName }}.

keys_without_cert_table.tooltip: These are keys that do not have a certificate on the device, including keys that were generated in the security server and whose certificate is stored only in the security server.

export.section: Download and distribute the security server TLS certificate to all client information systems to set up secure HTTPS connection.
export.title: Export Certificate

import.device_intro: If the key and certificate are on the signature creation device, import the certificate from the device to the security server.

device_state.LOGGED_OUT: Token is logged out. Log in to token first.
device_state.NOT_INITIALIZED: Token must be initialized using tools other than the UXP software before it can be used.
device_state.UNKNOWN: Security server can not access the token.

import.file_intro: If you received a certificate file, import the file to the security server.
import.title: Import Certificate

certificates.use_new_internal_tls_cert_section: Make sure all information systems connecting to this security server have started using the new certificate. If not, the connection between the information system and security server will fail. The old certificate will not be deleted, you can start using it again later if needed.
certificates.use_new_internal_tls_cert_title: Start using new security server internal TLS certificate?

hsm.device_delete_failed:
Deleting the key from the signature creation device failed.

Continue with just deleting the key and the {{type}} from this security server?
hsm.key_not_available:
Can not delete the key of this {{type}} from the signature creation device because security server can not access the key. 

The key may be already deleted from the device.

Continue with just deleting the key and the {{type}} from this security server?
hsm.key_only_device_delete_failed: Deleting the key {{keyName}} from the signature creation device failed. Continue with just deleting the key from this security server?
hsm.key_only_token_not_active: Can not delete the key {{keyName}} from the signature creation device because the status of the token {{tokenName}} is {{tokenStatus}}. You can either make sure that the token is logged in and delete again or delete the key only from the security server. Continue with just deleting the key from this security server?
hsm.key_only_token_unavailable:
Can not delete the key {{keyName}} from the signature creation device because security server can not access the key.

The key may be already deleted from the device

Continue with just deleting the key from this security server?
hsm.token_not_active: Can not delete the key of this {{type}} from the signature creation device because the status of the token {{tokenName}} is {{tokenStatus}}. You can either make sure that the token is logged in and delete again or delete the key only from the security server. Continue with just deleting the key and the {{type}} from this security server?

delete.key_only: Are you sure you want to delete the key {{keyName}}? The key will be deleted from the signature creation device as well.
delete.key_only_no_name: Are you sure you want to delete the key? The key will be deleted from the signature creation device as well.
delete.multiple_cert_csr: Can not delete the key of this {{type}} because the key {{keyName}} has other certificates or CSRs.
delete.single_cert: Are you sure you want to delete the key {{keyName}} and {{type}}?
delete.single_cert_key_on_sscd: Are you sure you want to delete the key {{keyName}} and {{type}}? The key will be deleted from the signature creation device as well.

dialog.choose_key_type_help: If you are unsure which key type to use, see the <textLink>User Guide</textLink>
dialog.csr_preview: This CSR is for the following subject distinguished name
dialog.delete_internal_cert: Are you sure you want to delete the security server internal TLS key and certificate?
dialog.delete_internal_cert_only: Can not delete the key of this certificate because the key has more certificates. Continue with just deleting the certificate?
dialog.enter_key_name: Enter key name for displaying in the user interface
dialog.internal_key_self_signed_notice: Note that the internal TLS certificate for this key is generated automatically and self-signed.
dialog.key_on_token: {{usage}} key will be generated on token {{tokenName}}.
dialog.no_ca: Can not generate key and CSR because Governing Authority has not approved any certification services.

registration.address: Security server public DNS name or IP address
registration.listening_port: The value for the listening port is taken from the configuration file.
registration.no_valid_sign_cert:
Can not register certificates because the security server owner has no functioning signing certificate.

To send the request, the owner must have at least one signing certificate that is with a good OCSP response, active and not expired.
registration.register: This certificate must be registered with the governing authority before it can be used.
registration.success_paragraph_1: You need to send the certificate to the Governing Authority by other means as well to complete the registration. If you have not already done this, follow the instructions of your Governing Authority for this process.
registration.success_paragraph_2: The certificate registration request will be confirmed by a person in the Governing Authority and might take a few days.

help.authentication: Used by security servers to establish secure connection with other security servers.
help.internal_authentication: Used by security server to establish secure connection with the information systems connected to it.
help.signing: Used by security server to sign UXP messages on behalf of the UXP members.

no_results.authentication: No authentication certificates or CSRs. Security server must have an authentication certificate to exchange messages.
no_results.internal_tls: No security server internal TLS certificates.

tooltip.cert_table_icon: This is a key and certificate pair.
tooltip.csr_table_icon: This is a key with a CSR (certificate signing request). Forward the CSR to the CA to receive a certificate.
tooltip.in_use_main: This certificate is used for TLS
tooltip.key_table_icon: This key does not have a certificate or CSR thus security server can not use it. You can delete this key. Security server will then try to delete it from the device as well.

unregistration.confirm: Are you sure you want to unregister the certificate from the Governing Authority?
unregistration.no_valid_auth_cert:
Can not unregister certificates because the security server has no functioning authentication certificate. 

 To send the request, there must be at least one authentication certificate that is registered, with a good OCSP response, active and not expired. 

 Continue with certificate deletion anyway?
unregistration.no_valid_license: Can not unregister certificates because the security server has no valid license. Continue with certificate deletion anyway?
unregistration.no_valid_sign_cert:
Can not unregister certificates because the security server owner has no functioning signing certificate. 

 To send the request, the owner must have at least one signing certificate that is with a good OCSP response, active and not expired. 

 Continue with certificate deletion anyway?
unregistration.request_failed: Failed to send certificate deletion request. Continue with certificate deletion?
unregistration.request_sent: Request sent to Governing Authority to unregister the certificate.

license.exists: System already contains a valid license
license.invalid: System contains an invalid license. Please upload a new license
license.missing: No license. Please upload a license file
license.title: License

tooltips.no_ssl_certificate: Security server does not authenticate the source of incoming requests from this subsystem. Turn on HTTPS to secure the connection.

services.confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete the timestamping service {{serviceName}}?
services.no_approved_services: No approved timestamping services. Please contact the Governing Authority.
services.no_services: No timestamping services. Security server must have at least one timestamping service to function properly.
services.title: Timestamping Services

tooltip.global_conf_not_found: The security server cannot use the timestamping service because there is no up-to-date global configuration.
tooltip.not_in_global_conf: The security server cannot use this timestamping service because it has either been temporarily or permanently disapproved by the governing authority. Please ensure that you have selected an alternative service.

add.add_new_device: Did not find a device you are looking for? <openDialog>Add a new device</openDialog>.
add.detected_tokens: Security server detected the following tokens on the device {{deviceName}}. To use a token as a storage for cryptographic keys, you must add it to the security server. You can skip this action for now.
add.device_disabled: Device is disabled. Enable device to see tokens.
add.intro: Choose a token for storing cryptographic keys that security server will use for signing.
add.no_devices: No signature creation devices, <openDialog>add a device</openDialog> first.
add.no_tokens_on_device: No tokens detected. Check the information you entered about the device and make sure the connection between the security server and the device is configured according to the manufacturers instructions. Check logs for more details.
add.row_no_tokens: No tokens detected on the device.

selected_token_intro.hardware: Choose a UXP member who will be using the slot {{ slotId }} from {{ deviceName }}.
selected_token_intro.software: Choose a UXP member who will be using the new software token.

add.title: Add Token
add.tokens_not_operational: Security server could not detect any functioning tokens from the device. Check the device connection and its parameters in security server.

hardware_token.title: If the signing key must be on an external signature creation device, add a hardware token.

software_token.title: If the signing key does not have to be on a signature creation device, you can add a software token.

delete.disclaimer: To avoid deleting important keys by accident, you must delete the keys and certificates from the security server before you can delete the token.

hardware_token.confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete the token and all its content from the security server?
hardware_token.disclaimer: Security server will not delete the key(s) from the physical device, but restoring the key(s) is possible only if the certificate is on the device as well.

delete.has_keys_one: The token {{tokenName}} has {{count}} key saved in this security server.
delete.has_keys_other: The token {{tokenName}} has {{count}} keys saved in this security server.

no_keys.primary: Are you sure you want to delete the token {{tokenName}} from the security server?
no_keys.secondary: The token has no keys in this security server.

software_token.disclaimer: It will not be possible to restore the key(s) once the token is deleted.

delete.title: Delete Token

dialog.final_attempt: 1 attempt left. Entering an incorrect PIN will lock the token.
dialog.init_pin_intro: Set a PIN to protect the keys on the token {{tokenName}}.
dialog.logout_confirm: Are you sure you want to log out of the token {{tokenName}}?
dialog.logout_confirm_consequence_one: The token has {{count}} key and certificate pair that will become unavailable and this may stop the message exchange.
dialog.logout_confirm_consequence_other: The token has {{count}} key and certificate pairs that will become unavailable and this may stop the message exchange.

import.alias_tooltip: Identify a key if keystore has multiple keys
import.browse: Browse for the PKCS#12 keystore that contains the certificate and key you want to import.
import.title: Import Keystore (PKCS#12)

tooltip.logged_out: Keys on token can not be used before the key manager logs in the token.
tooltip.not_initialized: Token must be initialized using tools other than the UXP software before it can be used.
tooltip.not_initialized_not_key_manager: The key manager must set the token PIN before using the token.
tooltip.unknown: Security server can not access the token.
tooltip.user_pin_count_low: An incorrect PIN has been entered at least once. Entering an incorrect PIN may lock the token.
tooltip.user_pin_final_try: Entering an incorrect PIN will lock the token.
tooltip.user_pin_locked: Token must be unlocked or reset using tools other than the UXP software before it can be used.

tooltip.view_only: You do not have Key Manager privileges for the owner of this token.

alerts.pw_change: The password for '{{ username }}' has been changed successfully.

dialogs.block_warning: Are you sure you want to block the user {{ username }}?
dialogs.change_password_relogin: Please log in to your account again.
dialogs.change_password_success: Your password has been changed successfully.
dialogs.delete_warning: Are you sure you want to delete the user {{ username }}?
dialogs.no_role_confirm: Are you sure you want to proceed?
dialogs.no_role_warning: You are trying to add a user with no roles. You can edit roles later.
dialogs.unblock_warning: Are you sure you want to unblock the user {{ username }}?

helpers.password_requirements: Password must include at least 12 characters. Avoid using common words, names or personal information in your password. Do not reuse old passwords.

members_table.role_for_all_members_tooltip: User has this role for all members.

tooltips.admin_always_key_manager: Server Administrator is always the Key Manager of the server owner.
tooltips.own_account_block: You cannot block your own account
tooltips.own_account_deletion: You cannot delete your own account
tooltips.own_account_unblock: You cannot unblock your own account

verification.data_missing: Can not verify the signature because the signature data is missing.
verification.new: Can not verify the signature before the signature is timestamped. Try again later.

tooltip.data_missing: Downloading the signature container is not possible because the signature data is missing.
tooltip.new: Downloading the signature container is not possible before the signature is timestamped. Try again later.

search.no_results: No results found. You must select from the available options.
